item.description: If you read RSS feeds -- tell me about some of your favorite feeds, and please include the URL of the feed. Thanks! ;-)

item.description:
@ton_zylstra @jdevalk I'm actively rebuilding my feeds world now.

Do you have a list of interesting feeds you would share with me??

item.description:
I want to add some new feeds to my reader, specifically interested in good Substack-type feeds by people readers of my blog might find interesting.

I'm going to demonstrate an idea I think all writers should work on, presenting collections of feeds of sources they value.

om -- you're already in my collection. ;-)
item.source:markdown:
I want to add some new feeds to my reader, specifically interested in good Substack-type feeds by people readers of my blog might find interesting.
I'm going to demonstrate an idea I think all writers should work on, presenting collections of feeds of sources they value.
om -- you're already in my collection. ;-)

item.description: I have to say King Charles has a lot of gravitas that Prince Charles didn't.
item.source:markdown: I have to say King Charles has a lot of gravitas that Prince Charles didn't.

item.description:
@jayrosen_nyu I read it without trying to guess, and considered what the author was saying and I think he probably came pretty close to describing Graham's reasons for doing this. Maybe you need an insider journalist to explain an insider politico.

@jayrosen_nyu That said Cilizza is a professional idiot. I actually met him in 2008 at the DNC waiting in line for press credentials one day. He's not actually a natural idiot, imho.
item.source:markdown:
@jayrosen_nyu I read it without trying to guess, and considered what the author was saying and I think he probably came pretty close to describing Graham's reasons for doing this. Maybe you need an insider journalist to explain an insider politico.
@jayrosen_nyu That said Cilizza is a professional idiot. I actually met him in 2008 at the DNC waiting in line for press credentials one day. He's not actually a natural idiot, imho.

item.description:
An request to whoever runs https://t.co/I4yGOJmkRW.

Instead of returning 404 for an favicon you don't have in your database, just redirect to a default icon.

Having an error message show up in the JS console in the browser doesn't serve any purpose.

TIA.
item.source:markdown:
An request to whoever runs https://t.co/I4yGOJmkRW.
Instead of returning 404 for an favicon you don't have in your database, just redirect to a default icon.
Having an error message show up in the JS console in the browser doesn't serve any purpose.
TIA.
